tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Broke through and won for the first time, capturing the weather-shortened Vana H Cup KBC Augusta. Shot rounds of 67-68-69 to edge Jung-Gon Hwang by two shots at Keya GC...Came close to winning earlier in the season, at the Diamond Cup Golf. Finished at 7-under 281 at Oarai GC, in a T2 position with Hyung-Sung Kim and Brad Kennedy, two shots shy of winner Hideki Matsuyama..Came back in his next start, the Japan Golf Tour Championship Shishido Hills with a strong, fourth-place showing. A final-round 68 vaulted him into fourth place, two shots behind winner Satoshi Kodaira...Second runner-up effort of the campaign came at the Fujisankei Classic. On the strength of a final-round, 1-under 69 at Fujizakura CC, made it into a playoff with Hideto Tanihara and Matsuyma, with Matsuyama prevailing...Third second-place performance came in September, at the Asia-Pacific Panasonic Open. After shooting a first-round 71, came back with middle rounds of 67-68 to take a two-shot 54-hole lead over Akio Sadakata, Y.E. Yang, Masahiro Kawamura and Tetsuji Hiratsuka. Shot a 1-under 71 on the final day but watched as Kawamura fired a 4-under 67 to take the one-shot victory. 


2012: After playing so well during his sophomore year, had something of a disappointing campaign on the Japan Golf Tour, failing to record a top-10 in 22 starts. Best finish came in his second event, the Tsuruya Open. Finished T13, thanks to a final-round 67.

2011: Recorded his first top-10 as a professional, opening with a 65 and then firing weekend rounds of 69-67 at The Crowns to T3...Added a T7 six starts later, recovering nicely from a third-round 77 at the Nagashima Shigeo Invitational Sega Sammy Cup by shooting a final-round 64 (10 birdies, two bogeys), moving up 31 places after starting the day tied for 38th. Ended up making 17 cuts in 20 official starts...Represented South Korea at the OMEGA Mission Hills World Cup in China. Teamed with Kim Hyung Sung to T9 with Spain (Alvaro Quiros and Miguel Angel Jimenez), combining for a best-ball score of 64 in the third round, the duo's best round of the week.

2010: Won the Japan Golf Tour Challenge Tour, winning the JGTO Novil Final in late-October. In the 54-hole event, shot rounds of 68-69-66 to cruise to a three-shot triumph over Hidezumi Shirakata...Joined the Japan Golf Tour and finished T27 in his first outing, the Tsuruya Open. Did not record a top-10, with his T20 at the Casio World Open his best performance.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: In a New Zealand golf tournament, claimed first-place honors among those under the age of 23. As a teenager, achieved the same feat in the category of players under the age of 19.
tourBios.personal: If not a golfer, says he would be a business man...Says his biggest thrill in golf is playing in front of large galleries. Biggest off-the-course thrill is playing tennis...Favorite kinds of book are those dealing with psychology...Previously lived in New Zealand and was affiliated with North Shore GC. English name is Andrew.

tourBios.intlVics: (2): 2010 JGTO Novil Final [JpnChall]. 2013 Vana H Cup KBC Augusta [Jpn].
tourBios.carHigh:
2014-15: Made 13 of 27 PGA TOUR cuts, with one top-10 to complete the season No. 135 in the FedExCup standings in his rookie season...Was T2 at the Humana Challenge in just his fifth career PGA TOUR start. Shot rounds of 68-67-67-65 to finish one stroke behind winner Bill Haas.

2013-14: Ended the season with 15 Web.com Tour starts, posting five top-25s, highlighted by a T3 and a T5...Shot opening and closing rounds of 67-66 for a T3 finish at the Chile Classic in March...Fired a bogey-free 64 Saturday at the Air Capital Classic. Started the final round three shots back, finished with a 68, good for a T5...Missed the cut in the first two Web.com Tour Finals' events, before recording a T14 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship and a T11 at the Web.com Tour Championship. At TPC Sawgrass' Dye's Valley Course, opened with a 65. Began that final week $14,500 behind the 50th-card-position holder. A $23,000 check paved his way to the PGA TOUR for the first time.

2013: Broke through and won for the first time, capturing the weather-shortened Vana H Cup KBC Augusta. Shot rounds of 67-68-69 to edge Jung-Gon Hwang by two shots at Keya GC...Came close to winning earlier in the season, at the Diamond Cup Golf. Amateur: In a New Zealand golf tournament, claimed first-place honors among those under the age of 23. As a teenager, achieved the same feat in the category of players under the age of 19.

Biggest off-the-course thrill is playing tennis...Favorite kinds of book are those dealing with psychology...Previously lived in New Zealand and was affiliated with North Shore GC. English name is Andrew.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T2nd in 2015 at the Humana Challenge in partnership with the Clinton Foundation.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T19th in Victory Leaders on the PGA TOUR.
